page.title: 20Wyrley Cottages and Wood.
page.content: Wyrley cottages were built in 1871, the same date as our school.There were two cottages but now they have been made into one cottage.There is a family of four people living there and the father works at a nearby farm.Next to Wyrley cottages there used to be two little farms. The fields around the cottages are used for wheat and pastureland.The field on the right is called the Windmill field which goes behind the Wyrley wood.A long time ago the windmill which is no longer there pumped water for all the area. The wood was called Cranberry Moss because it was the only wood on the estate with cranberries in it.One of the oak trees is 830 cms around the trunk.We found an interesting bottle in the wood.
